website_summaries.verdict: This collection of previously published LSATs is a good "hands on" addition to other study guides.
pros: Contains 10 actual LSAT tests previously administered to real students
Compiled and endorsed by LSAC (Law School Admissions Council)
Includes answer keys for each test section
cons: Logic game section does not include worksheet
Contains LSAT questions, but no additional study material

customer_reviews.title: Great Study Tool
customer_reviews.text: As expected. This is 10 official tests, back to back. There are no answer explanations, only an answer key, but that was expected based on the product description. Does its job. I think the absolute best way to prep for the test is simply by taking older tests. This is not an information based test, it is a test of skills - and the only way to improve a skill is through practice! I scored a 154 my first time taking the LSAT, and I am currently studying for the next one where I will hopefully do better. Still plugging away at these older tests.
customer_reviews.author: pixiedust

customer_reviews.title: it's very important to be prepared for what the test day is actually like. Plus
customer_reviews.text: Item exactly as advertised. Taking actual practice exams (under simulated testing conditions!) is an integral part of doing well on the LSAT. Tip: Since the actual exam has 5 multiple choice sections (4 graded, 1 ungraded) but these released practice tests only contain the 4 graded sections, use the sections of one or two of the tests to simulate the extra ungraded section. While this means you will only be able to take 8 full-length practice tests under simulated conditions, it's very important to be prepared for what the test day is actually like. Plus, you will still be "taking" those two other tests, just not all at once.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Don't EVER buy a used test prep book!!!
customer_reviews.text: The description said minor writing but this book has ALL the exams written. What a waste and moreover, why sell it just to be a pain to someone else. It's my own dumb fault and now I have to order a new book and throw this crap away. Please do everyone a favor and throw the test prep books in the trash if you write all over it.
customer_reviews.author: PerfectPoodle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for simulating the actual test
customer_reviews.text: This book is great! Let me explain the use of this book. This book is for AFTER studying very well. It’s just a simulation of what the real test is. THE SCORES ARE ACCURATE! I did 2-3 practice tests and got 134 each time. I got 135 on the real test. I’m planning to retake the test. Barrons is a good way to prepare for the test and this book will SIMULATE taking the actual test. The test is going digital so, I am not sure if it will be the same. I would still use this book.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great way to practice
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend taking as many practice tests with review as possible before taking the actual test. I used this practice set as a sub for real practice tests because it has some of the most recent exams. Test under timed conditions. Review (without looking at answers) untimed. Review looking at answers and explanations. Repeat.
customer_reviews.author: Dolmanet

customer_reviews.title: Actual Tests
customer_reviews.text: I found the best way to prep was by doing questions from actual tests (rather than questions made up by prep companies), and sitting down and running timed full tests. I bought a couple these volumes (each volume has 10 full tests) to do that - check the number of the tests to see which years they are from and do several, but definitely the most recent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Need I say anything else? Every single question had the answers circled in pen. This book is virtually useless and the fact that it wasn’t noticed before resale is shocking.
customer_reviews.author: Lemonjello Cornfoot

customer_reviews.title: Games Are Too Easy!
customer_reviews.text: The book is a standard LSAC book and I’ve been happy with all four I have purchased. However, the Games section in this book is far too easy. For people who struggle with the games section and want to ease in, I highly recommend this book. But if you’re only going to buy one book, obviously you should buy the most recent one. In summation: fine book but the Games are too easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't take the LSAT without this!
customer_reviews.text: I would not even recommend taking the LSAT until you've looked at these books (the entire series). It served as a GREAT tool. I used it alternatively as diagnostics and as practice. Surprisingly lightweight by the way, I used this on the train on my way to work to give myself a little review and during lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Must have for LSAT takers
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic set of tests. They come with the tests, answer key, scoring key, and test answering sheets in the back. I would highly recommend this book if you are looking to take the LSAT since these tests are very recent. That means if you are on a tight budget you should always try to get the test books that contain the most recent tests. Overall a great product that can help you succeed on the LSAT!
customer_reviews.author: LawSchoolHopeful

customer_reviews.title: Must have for LSAT
customer_reviews.text: this is a must have for the LSAT I wish I purchased this much sooner but nonetheless it really is a life saver. it's the exact same style and format of the actual exam. there are no explanations but if you google Graeme LSAT hacks he has explanations for every single LSAT practice test so I would take the test grade myself and look up the explanations. very useful
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Super important to prepare for LSAT!
customer_reviews.text: I worked through all of these after finishing the PowerScore LSAT trio in preparation for the LSAT. Having these tests was super helpful in practicing my timing, getting familiar with the test layout, and gauging where I stood in terms of preparedness (answer keys are provided).
customer_reviews.author: Varth dader

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best way to improve on the LSAT is to practice
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best way to improve on the LSAT is to practice. Also being able to grade them myself and understand how the grading process works and seeing what sections I did well and not so well in really helped me improve. From the beginning of this book to the actual LSAT I took, I improved by 10 points.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Elise

customer_reviews.title: This is the best resource you can buy for studying for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: This is the best resource you can buy for studying for the LSAT. You have to practice like you play, and, for the LSAT, that play is taking the official test. Be sure to follow the time limits strictly at all times; otherwise, you won't get a test-like experience.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: This is essential for LSAT preparation. Personally I feel ...
customer_reviews.text: This is essential for LSAT preparation. Personally I feel LSAC should make at least 10 past tests free on their website, but since they do not seem to agree with me that the hundreds of dollars we pay them could cover such a benefit, this book does the job.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: A few cons.
customer_reviews.text: Useful, however I was disappointed to see that each logic game was fitted to one page, leaving no room to actual work out the problem- on the actual LSAT, we are given 2 pages per game. In addition, I would have liked to see 5 sections per preptests so that I could better practice. I remember taking the exam and being under prepared for the 5 section exam. It was exhausting.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: This book is great for anyone wanting to study for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: This book is great for anyone wanting to study for the LSAT. I used this book in combination with a study guide and was able to pass with a 169. The only catch is that you need to follow what the study guide says to prepare for the time limits on the actual LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Dial

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I am no longer going to law school, so it was a waste for me. however, it was 10 actual exams lmao
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great as a prep for me
customer_reviews.text: Worked great as a prep for me, except that the logic portion on the real test contained a different style of question than any I had encountered in this book.
customer_reviews.author: LibertarianLibrarian

customer_reviews.title: If you're taking the LSAT, get a strategy book ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're taking the LSAT, get a strategy book from whoever, work through it, then get this (or whatever the newer version is). It is paramount to work through a couple of real, full tests before you take the exam. In your last week or so prior to the test, I'd do a timed one a day.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Definitely get these books if you're studying for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Really good books for being able to take the more recent practice tests. They even give you answer sheets in the back that you can fill out as you take the tests, as well as the written sections too! Definitely important to get if you're studying for the lsat
customer_reviews.author: Tabina Haider

customer_reviews.title: Great for studying
customer_reviews.text: Great for studying. There honestly isn't any way to get better at the LSAT than taking other, old exams.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to Complain about
customer_reviews.text: the product is well protected when it is delivered; the product description is accurate; I have nothing to complain about.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The book is in perfect condition. Like I flipped through and there’s two pen marks. I was slightly worried since it said markings but it’s perfect.

customer_reviews.text: Great prep book with full tests, examples, and explanations. Used this with a tutor to prepare

customer_reviews.text: These tests will get you ready for the contemporary LSAT administrations.

customer_reviews.title: These give you a great idea of what the test is really like
customer_reviews.text: You absolutely cannot do without real prep tests when studying for the LSAT. These give you a great idea of what the test is really like, and when combined with a site like LSAT QA, they help you identify and attack your weak points. As an added bonus, buying your tests in a set like this is much cheaper than buying each test individually (although I do recommend getting at least one individual test so that you're used to the booklet experience before test day).

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful, brougt my average up nearly ten points.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to go to law school and the next LSAT's were in a month. I only had four weeks to prepare and had been our of school for a 25 years. No test prep classes were available so I decided to try these books. After a few weeks my averages on the practice tests improved to over 160. If you decide to try these just be sure to review your wrong answers.

customer_reviews.author: Martinelli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent But Save These Tests
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book. But don't start here. Because this book (which is Volume V) has 10 very recent official LSATs, you want to take all these tests timed before you take the official test, but not before you take some older tests first. For example, I'd suggest getting, which is Volume IV, and, which is Volume III, and take those. Basically, you want to take older tests before you take newer tests because the newer tests are harder. Learn the fundamentals on the old tests so you don't "waste" the newer ones until you're ready to take them.
customer_reviews.author: B. Olson
